Name: Wahoo
Fate: Sunk by Japanese ships and aircraft in La Pérouse Strait, 11 October 1943[2]
Displacement:
1,525 long tons (1,549 t) surfaced[2]
2,424 long tons (2,463 t) submerged[2]
Propulsion:
4 × Fairbanks-Morse Model 38D8-⅛ 10-cylinder opposed piston diesel engines driving electrical generators[2][3]
2 × 126-cell Sargo batteries[4]
4 × high-speed General Electric electric motors with reduction gears[2]
two propellers[2]
5,400 shp (4.0 MW) surfaced[2]
2,740 shp (2.0 MW) submerged[2]
Speed:
21 kn (24 mph; 39 km/h) surfaced[4]
9 kn (10 mph; 17 km/h) submerged[4]
Range: 11,000 nmi (13,000 mi; 20,000 km) surfaced at 10 kn (12 mph; 19 km/h)[4]
Endurance:
48 hours at 2 kn (2 mph; 4 km/h) submerged[4]
75 days on patrol
Armament:
10 × 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes
  (six forward, four aft; 24 Mark 14 torpedoes[4]
1 × 3 in (76 mm) / 50 caliber deck gun[4]
Bofors 40 mm and Oerlikon 20 mm cannon
